comments:
You can reproduce the bug by associating *.a files to the assembly editor of CDT. Try to open an .a file and you will have an error. The assembly editor has no problems when the files are rename to *.asm.

error:

Unable to create this part due to an internal error. Reason for the failure: Cannot create file buffer.

Our customer ran into the same problem. He tried to open a file with .o extension in editor and he got the exception. He can't actually open the file with any available editors.
Can you tell us why CDT created content types for the binary files like .o and .a? Is it possible to provide some message instead of throwing exception?
